thread.title: Main break leaves some Bellevue residents without water
thread.title_full: Main break leaves some Bellevue residents without water | The Seattle Times

author: Jennifer Sullivan
title: Main break leaves some Bellevue residents without water
text:
A nearly 50-year-old water main broke in northeast Bellevue Monday night, affecting about 100 apartment units.
The water main feeds the Woodland Commons Apartments, in the 13700 block of Northeast 11th Street, said Michael May, spokesman for Bellevue’s utilities department. Crews worked on the water line into the night and it was almost completely repaired on Monday morning, he said. In the meantime, residents in the large apartment complex had to use bottled water and portable toilets.
Residents are being issued a 48-hour boil water notice, May said. “It’s just out of abundance of caution. When water mains break contaminants can enter the system,” May said.
May said the water line dates back to the 1950s.
 Jennifer Sullivan: 206-464-8294 or jensullivan@seattletimes.com . On Twitter @SeattleSullivan .
